DOC.detailed_description: Overweight obesity serious problem Mexican-American child , due part poverty , acculturation , genetic predisposition factor . Clinic-based weight control study show promise , often include convenience sample Latino child . This randomize controlled trial test efficacy culturally linguistically appropriate , evidence-based intervention lower Body Mass Index ( BMI ) slow weight gain among overweight 6-9 year old Mexican-American child randomly sample large ( 36,192 pediatric patient ) community clinic provide service low medium income family US-Mexico border community ( San Ysidro , CA ) . Intervention measurement design selection base `` Socioecological Model Latino Health Promotion '' . Children parent randomly assign either Special Intervention ( SI ) Usual Care ( UC ) group . The SI group participate follow behavior change activity base Prevention Plus Structured Weight Management approach : 1. class provide culturally-sensitive health education regard healthy eating , increase physical activity , decrease sedentary behavior , effective parenting behavior model reinforce child 's health behavior , instruction modify social structural aspect home environment , skills-building navigate community resource ; 2. clinical visit Health Educator Mid-Level Provider ( MLP ) ; 3. family visit primary care provider ( PCP ) ; 4. phone call reinforce goal setting . The UC group receive standard health education childhood obesity already provide community clinic . The primary outcome study child BMI , along change physical outcome , child health behavior parent behavior evaluate four time-points ( baseline , 6- , 12- , 18-months ) . The primary hypothesis SI group demonstrate lower mean BMI UC group end 6 month intervention maximum difference occur 12 month , sustain difference additional six month ( 18 month baseline ) . Secondary aim include examine intervention effect child 's energy balance , physical activity level , sedentary behavior parent strategy relate child 's health behavior .
